titles: To the Kings most Excellent Maiesty The humble gratulation; and petition of the trained bands, and freeholders, and others the gentry and communalty of the county palatine of Chester, whose names and vnder-written. Delivered upon Hoole-Heath, by the trayned bands, a coppie of the same being hung upon the top of every colours; subscribed by the severall companies, and so presented to the King.
notes: Praying that enquiry may be made as to the use to which monies levied in the county for the relief of Ireland have been put.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Ireland --  History --  Rebellion of 1641 --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Civil War, 1642-1649 --  Early works to 1800.
